title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description:
Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement

Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. And then the user needs figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes?
<Yes>
<No>
<Cancel>

Yes would save the changes
No would discard the changes
Cancel would do nothing and remain on the Source page

In addition, the dialog is titled 'Error'.
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed. The message indicates that the user needs to save their changes. The error message is 'Source page is dirty.'
EB: A better and more typical approach would be for the XML Report Designer editor to provide a clear and informative message to the user when trying to switch views, directing them to save or discard their changes before proceeding. The message should not be titled 'Error' and should not include quotes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.

Note the error message and behavior described above.
